meanings.definition: A building material made from a mixture of cement, sand, and water.
meanings.sent1: The workers poured concrete to build the foundation.
meanings.sent2: The sidewalk was made of concrete.
meanings.sent3: Why did the concrete refuse to play hide and seek? Because it always stood out!
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as solid as concrete.
meanings.sent5: The weight of the concrete block was immense.

meanings.definition: A solid mass formed by the hardening of a liquid substance.
meanings.sent1: The concrete in the mold slowly hardened into a strong block.
meanings.sent2: The spilled milk dried into a concrete mass on the floor.
meanings.sent3: The concrete in the cupcake batter made them extra crunchy.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like concrete, unyielding and strong.
meanings.sent5: The concrete of the dam held back the rushing water.

meanings.sent1: She gave a concrete example to explain the concept.
meanings.sent2: The instructions were clear and concrete.
meanings.sent3: His plan was as concrete as a brick wall.
meanings.sent4: The memory of that day was concrete in her mind.
meanings.sent5: The evidence was concrete and undeniable.

meanings.definition: To make something solid or real.
meanings.sent1: He tried to concrete his dream into a successful business.
meanings.sent2: The artist concreted his vision into a beautiful sculpture.
meanings.sent3: She concreted her commitment by signing the contract.
meanings.sent4: The team concreted their bond through hard work.
meanings.sent5: They concreted their friendship with a handshake.
